return_description: An NSData object containing plist in the format specified by format.

Methods.method_description: Returns an NSData object containing a given property list in a specified format.

return_description: The number of bytes written to the stream. A return value of 0 indicates that an error occurred.

Methods.method_description: Writes a property list to the specified stream.

return_description: A property list object corresponding to the representation in data. If data is not in a supported format, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Creates and returns a property list from the specified data.

return_description: A property list object corresponding to the representation in data. If data is not in a supported format, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: Creates and returns a property list by reading from the specified stream.

return_description: true if plist is a valid property list in format format, otherwise false.

Methods.method_description: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given property list is valid for a given format.

return_description: An NSData object containing plist in the format specified by format.

Methods.method_description: This method is obsolete and will be deprecated soon.DeprecatedUse data(fromPropertyList:format:options:) instead.

return_description: A property list object corresponding to the representation in data. If data is not in a supported format, returns nil.

Methods.method_description: This method is deprecated. Use data(fromPropertyList:format:options:) instead.DeprecatedUse propertyList(from:options:format:) instead.

Vars.var_description: An error was encountered while parsing the property list.
The version number of the property list is unable to be determined.
A stream error was encountered while reading the property list.
A stream error was encountered while writing the property list.
Marks beginning of the range of error codes reserved for property list errors.
Marks end of the range of error codes reserved for property list errors.

class_description:
The PropertyListSerialization class provides methods that convert a property list to and from several serialized formats. A property list is itself an array or dictionary that contains only NSData, NSString, NSArray, NSDictionary, NSDate, and NSNumber objects.
Property list objects are toll-free bridged with their respective Core Foundation types (CFData, CFString, and so on). See Toll-Free Bridging  for more information on toll-free bridging.
